com.viaoa.hub

Class HubLeftJoin<A extends OAObject,B extends OAObject>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.hub.HubLeftJoin<A,B>

  • public class HubLeftJoin<A extends OAObject,B extends OAObject>
extends java.lang.Object
    Combines two hubs into a new single hub to create the equivalent of a database left join, where all of the "left" side objects are in the list. The combined Hub (see getCombinedHub) uses OAObject OALeftJoin, where A is the same class as the left Hub and B is the same as the right Hub. A property path that uses A or B will need to use casting. Example: LeftHub=hubDepartments, RightHub=hubEmployees with last name "Jones" the combined Hub A=Dept ref, B=Employee ref, can use hubCombined with properties from A or B, with casting: hubCombined, "(com.xxx.Department)A.manager.fullName" or a better solution: OAString.cpp(Departement.class, OALeftJoin.P_A, Department.P_Manager, Employee.P_FullName)
    Author:
    vvia
    See Also:
    HubLeftJoinDetail#, HubGroupBy#
